questions.question: Which sentence contains an incorrect placement of the adverb?
options: She rarely goes out during the week.
They have completely understood the concept.
He sings beautifully the national anthem.
I will probably see you tomorrow.
questions.answer: He sings beautifully the national anthem.

questions.question: Which of the following sentences uses an adverb of degree incorrectly or awkwardly?
options: He was deeply moved by the performance.
She is completely sure of her decision.
I strongly believe that she is right.
The weather was entirely hot yesterday.
questions.answer: The weather was entirely hot yesterday.
